text: Talcott Mountain State Park is a public recreation area located on Talcott Mountain in the towns of Avon, Bloomfield, and Simsbury, Connecticut. The state park features the Heublein Tower, a mountaintop lookout. Access to the tower and its associated museum is via a trail that takes 30 to 40 minutes to walk. The park offers picnicking, views of the surrounding area, and hiking along the Metacomet Trail. ==References== ==External links== *Talcott Mountain State Park Connecticut Department of Energy and Environmental Protection *Talcott Mountain State Park Map Connecticut Department of Energy and Environmental Protection Category:Simsbury, Connecticut Category:State parks of Connecticut Category:Parks in Hartford County, Connecticut Category:Metacomet Ridge, Connecticut Category:Protected areas established in 1965 Category:1965 establishments in Connecticut
